title: Splendor
tagline: Race to build an empire with just the right balance of prestige and efficiency.
good: Evaluation of ambiguous, probabilistic values in the first half.
Finding the most efficient path to close out the game in the second.
The satisfaction of timing your switch between the two halves perfectly, and watching your engine work.
bad: You want a social experience. The average game of Splendor doesn't involve much talking (sometimes you can hear the brain-gears grinding).
Small number arithmetic isn't your idea of fun. That said, they tend to be very small numbers.
note: Plays great with all player counts.
For a fairly light, euro-ish, game, there is a surprising amount of player interaction. However, it is entirely based on blocking, which some may not like.
Fast to play, nice components, and simple rules make Splendor a famously great gateway game.
The expansion is fine. Get it if you love the base game, but it's not required.
